page.title: 17Gravel extraction
page.content: The Amey Roadstone Company, known as ARC, quarries materials from the rough heathland along Puddletown Road. Various grades of sand and gravel are extracted to be used in road building, and some is made into blocks for general building purposes. Spent quarries are restored to agriculture where possible, or to forestry use, while poorer land is returned to heathland by planting with the top layer removed when making a new quarry. ll0 acres of land which will not yield any useful materials have been leased to the Dorset Naturalists' Trust for conservation purposes. ARC employs something under 50 men at the Gallows Hill operation and is an important factor in the local economy.
